p: Among patients with respiratory infections, the median age was 12.7 months (IQR: 5.7–24.3). Inpatients ( n = 65) were younger than outpatients ( n = 59), due to study enrolment criteria (Table 2). Bronchiolitis (as assessed at the discretion of treating physicians) was the most common clinical diagnosis (57% in outpatients and 61% in inpatients). Thirty-five percent of inpatients had a clinical diagnosis of pneumonia (Table 2).
